author: djrtwo
content:
if the eth1 fork(s) was not more than the `ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE`, eth2 would process deposits as normal
If the fork exceeded that depth, eth2 and eth1 wrt deposits could become out of sync

This represents a huge issue with eth1 (regardless of the eth2 link) and would be a signal that the mining environment is essentially broken
